result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas R Konsella was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA  Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

Consecutive to: current sentence

The Court has reviewed the Debtor's pro se correspondence and takes no action on the request - 9/6/16.
Defendant's DRC privileges are hereby revoked for the condition time imposed.  Defendant is to be returned to the Huber facility for the balance of the condition time if any remains to be served.

Day Report Center Informational Court Report
Sentencing hearing on May 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thomas R Konsella in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge. Parties are requesting a separate sentencing date. Court grants.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas R Konsella in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with any witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Thomas R Konsella in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
from defendant pleading no contest.  Received after court.
